qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps package¶

Submodules¶

qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.data_mapping module¶

This module contains the definition of data mapping function for feature map.

qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.data_mapping.self_product(x)[source]¶

Define a function map from R^n to R.

Parameters:x (np.ndarray) – data
Returns:the mapped value
Return type:double

qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.feature_map module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for feature map. Several types of commonly used approaches.

class qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.feature_map.FeatureMap[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.pluggable.Pluggable

Base class for FeatureMap.

This method should initialize the module and its configuration, and use an exception if a component of the module is available.

Parameters:configuration (dict) – configuration dictionary
static check_pluggable_valid()¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

configuration¶

Return pluggable configuration.

construct_circuit(x, qr=None, inverse=False)[source]¶

Construct the variational form, given its parameters.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray[float]) – 1-D array, data
  • qr (QauntumRegister) – the QuantumRegister object for the circuit, if None, generate new registers with name q.
  • inverse (bool) – whether or not inverse the circuit
Returns:

a quantum circuit.
Return type:

QuantumCircuit

qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.first_order_expansion module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for feature map. Several types of commonly used approaches.

class qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.first_order_expansion.FirstOrderExpansion(num_qubits, depth=2, data_map_func=<function self_product>)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.pauli_z_expansion.PauliZExpansion

Mapping data with the first order expansion without entangling gates.

Refer to https://arxiv.org/pdf/1804.11326.pdf for details.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'First order expansion for feature map', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'First_Order_Expansion_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'depth': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 2, 'minimum': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'FirstOrderExpansion'}¶
__init__(num_qubits, depth=2, data_map_func=<function self_product>)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (int) – number of qubits
  • depth (int) – the number of repeated circuits
  • data_map_func (Callable) – a mapping function for data x
static check_pluggable_valid()¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

configuration¶

Return pluggable configuration.

construct_circuit(x, qr=None, inverse=False)¶

Construct the second order expansion based on given data.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1-D to-be-transformed data.
  • qr (QauntumRegister) – the QuantumRegister object for the circuit, if None, generate new registers with name q.
  • inverse (bool) – whether or not inverse the circuit
Returns:

a quantum circuit transform data x.
Return type:

qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.pauli_expansion module¶

This module contains the definition of a base class for feature map. Several types of commonly used approaches.

class qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.pauli_expansion.PauliExpansion(num_qubits, depth=2, entangler_map=None, entanglement='full', paulis=['Z', 'ZZ'], data_map_func=<function self_product>)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.feature_map.FeatureMap

Mapping data with the second order expansion followed by entangling gates. Refer to https://arxiv.org/pdf/1804.11326.pdf for details.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'Pauli expansion for feature map (any order)', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'Pauli_Expansion_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'depth': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 2, 'minimum': 1}, 'entangler_map': {'type': ['object', 'null'], 'default': None}, 'entanglement': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'full', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['full', 'linear']}]}, 'paulis': {'type': ['array'], 'items': {'type': 'string'}, 'default': ['Z', 'ZZ']}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'PauliExpansion'}¶
__init__(num_qubits, depth=2, entangler_map=None, entanglement='full', paulis=['Z', 'ZZ'], data_map_func=<function self_product>)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (int) – number of qubits
  • depth (int) – the number of repeated circuits
  • entangler_map (dict) – describe the connectivity of qubits
  • entanglement (str) – [‘full’, ‘linear’], generate the qubit connectivitiy by predefined topology
  • paulis (str) – a comma-seperated string for to-be-used paulis
  • data_map_func (Callable) – a mapping function for data x
static check_pluggable_valid()¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

configuration¶

Return pluggable configuration.

construct_circuit(x, qr=None, inverse=False)[source]¶

Construct the second order expansion based on given data.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1-D to-be-transformed data.
  • qr (QauntumRegister) – the QuantumRegister object for the circuit, if None, generate new registers with name q.
  • inverse (bool) – whether or not inverse the circuit
Returns:

a quantum circuit transform data x.
Return type:

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.pauli_z_expansion.PauliZExpansion

Mapping data with the second order expansion followed by entangling gates.

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (int) – number of qubits
  • depth (int) – the number of repeated circuits
  • entangler_map (dict) – describe the connectivity of qubits
  • entanglement (str) – [‘full’, ‘linear’], generate the qubit connectivitiy by predefined topology
  • data_map_func (Callable) – a mapping function for data x

class qiskit_aqua.components.feature_maps.PauliExpansion(num_qubits, depth=2, entangler_map=None, entanglement='full', paulis=['Z', 'ZZ'], data_map_func=<function self_product>)[source]¶

Mapping data with the second order expansion followed by entangling gates. Refer to https://arxiv.org/pdf/1804.11326.pdf for details.

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'Pauli expansion for feature map (any order)', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'Pauli_Expansion_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'depth': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 2, 'minimum': 1}, 'entangler_map': {'type': ['object', 'null'], 'default': None}, 'entanglement': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'full', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['full', 'linear']}]}, 'paulis': {'type': ['array'], 'items': {'type': 'string'}, 'default': ['Z', 'ZZ']}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'PauliExpansion'}¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_qubits (int) – number of qubits
  • depth (int) – the number of repeated circuits
  • entangler_map (dict) – describe the connectivity of qubits
  • entanglement (str) – [‘full’, ‘linear’], generate the qubit connectivitiy by predefined topology
  • paulis (str) – a comma-seperated string for to-be-used paulis
  • data_map_func (Callable) – a mapping function for data x
